hello.intro: Winter sets the frame for two fast weeks at the Desert Holiday Series, December 3–14, split into DH1 and DH2 with momentum building through the second week. Under desert light, classes range from national to FEI, with CSI5* highlights and MLSJ team energy anchoring primetime. At the base of the mountains, Desert International Horse Park runs on clean sightlines, all‑weather footing, and wide schooling lanes that keep ring flow steady. Thermal, California stays practical and close, so time off course turns into short resets rather than drives. Get the schedule pulse on the [Desert Holiday Series](https://deserthorsepark.com/events/) page, then picture the grounds and arena layout at [Desert International Horse Park](https://deserthorsepark.com/). Keep eyes up; we run the plan.

stay.title: Sleep Close to DIHP
stay.paragraph: Aim for zero‑friction mornings and quiet recovery at night. Keep drives short, parking simple, and layouts walkable so resets between rounds stay quick. La Quinta Resort & Club delivers roomy casitas and calm paths for fast debriefs, while Renaissance Esmeralda adds polished service and dependable late‑return windows that keep evenings controlled. Also consider: Holiday Inn Express & Suites; JW Marriott Desert Springs. Spectator tip: La Quinta’s grounds and Esmeralda’s pool terraces give relaxed viewing breaks between classes. CTA: I’ll lock rooms near the rings.

dine.title: Eat Efficiently Nearby
dine.paragraph: Plan food like gear: predictable, close, and timed so warm‑ups and course walks never slip. The Cafe at Shields Date Garden covers quick greens and wraps between trips, and Heirloom Craft Kitchen is a steady midday stop when turnarounds tighten; after late classes, Lavender Bistro or Arnold Palmer’s offers a calm, seated finish, and LG’s Prime Steakhouse keeps steak night simple. Also consider: Tack Room Tavern. Spectator tip: Outdoor tables at Heirloom and Lavender make post‑round reviews easy. CTA: I’ll book two dinner holds nightly.

locale.title: Desert Downtime, Minutes Away
locale.paragraph: Between rounds, use small windows for recovery and clear air. Short drives from Thermal open mountain views, simple walking paths, and quick coffee stops. Keep it light on show days—a brief stroll and one errand—then save longer detours for off‑days. Close near the grounds with two helpful resources: [Facility Map](https://deserthorsepark.com/facility-tours/) and [Onsite Dining](https://deserthorsepark.com/onsite-dining/).
locale.spectator_tip: Plan one short off‑grounds reset; save excursions for off‑days.

essentials.title: Barn Basics On Hand
essentials.paragraph: Lock down essentials so mornings stay clear and the barn runs without questions. Stock staples nearby, tap on‑grounds vendors for show‑specific needs, and secure wheels before arrival. Ralphs covers groceries and ice, CVS Pharmacy handles meds and tape, and DIHP vendors stock feed, bedding, and tack during shows; wheels stay straightforward with Enterprise for SUVs and Dever, Inc. for golf carts. Also consider: advance cart reservations on peak weekends. CTA: I’ll stock barn basics and ice.
